Smidgen:::
Smidgen had climbed back into the ship to gather supplies and other 
things she would need for camping out that night.  She had gathered 
the emergency food/energon rathions, a few small back up lights that 
were battery opperated, she even took out the lazy boy co-pilot 
chair and stuck the base into the ground. Deciding to stay night, 
she made a small circle of stones and built a campfire. She sat back 
in her lazy boy chair with her pistol still at her side.  Being in 
unkwon territory still made her feel uneasy.  BUt she had figurerd 
that since no bot had come for her by now, probably no bot would.  
She pulled out a small energon cube fron her lunch pack and munched 
on it contently. She saw a small bird land on a nearby trtee 
branch. "So what's this place called? What's the rest of the wild 
life like? Oh, and let me guess, you want to see my transport papers 
right?" she laughed and chuckled. "Ahh, first real sign of life, and 
it can't even tell me where to find a fast food joint in these 
parts."  She was finally starting to feel relaxed about this place.  
Feeling somewhat restless though, she got up and placed a few empty 
containers on a log and started to work on target practice. She hit 
most of them, but she was no great marksbot.  She sighed and kept 
practicing.  She hit them all down and stood them back up to shoot 
again.  While shooting, her small pocket scanner started showing a 
blib heading in her direction.  But she didn't hear it over the 
pistol fire. "DANG! I Knew I should have gone to those target 
classes back in school!"  She kept up her taret practice, unaware of 
her scanner. 




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Bored again, Jackie wanders aimlessly about the base, with his 
> internal music player blaring Bob Seger.  (One has to wonder how 
the 
> rest of the Maximals like hearing this stuff rattling 
deckplates.)  
> Slipping into the control room, he notices that one of the 
scanners 
> is picking up a homing signal.  Scratching his head, he pulls out 
a 
> datapad and types out a quick note:  "Gone to check out signal - 
Back 
> soon.  Jackie."  Switching off the player, he dashes out, 
transforms 
> to vehicle mode, and races toward the source of the broadcast.
>
